text: Start cooking your pasta. Cook according to package directions, but do not rinse after straining. Melt your butter in a large saucepan.  When fully melted, add flour and stir. Do not pour the flour in one pile, or it will stick together. This is a roux, cook it for a minute or so to cook out the flour taste. Add the milk, half a cup at a time. You may get lumps, that's fine, either fish them out or leave in. They usually cook out. Stir the milk until it begins to boil.  Turn off the burner and remove the milk from the stove.  Add the cheese. Stir for a couple minutes until melted If it is not melting, turn put it back on the stove and stir constantly. If you haven't already, strain your pasta and put it back in the pot. DO NOT rinse it (rinsing will wash the starch off and make the sauce not stick as well.) If you are adding any vegetables or meat, add them here. Add the sauce to the pasta. Stir and fold to combine. Scoop into bowls or onto plates for a tasty side dish. Add corn/peas and canned tuna/chicken for a complete meal.
